arts.ttl: Pep Guardiola names two debutants in strong Man City lineup against Leyton Orient
arts.sum: Pep Guardiola handed debuts to Nico Gonzalez and Vitor Reis in a relatively strong Manchester City starting XI for Saturday's FA Cup fourth-round tie against Leyton Orient. While the Catalan coach was expected to name a highly inexperienced and youthful XI - similar to the one which racked up eight unanswered goals against Salford City in the third round - Guardiola started only one teenage academy graduate, the sought-after Nico O'Reilly .

arts.ttl: Erling Haaland tipped for Real Madrid revenge in Man City tie - 'That will bother him'
arts.sum: Real Madrid are familiar opponents for Erling Haaland but the Manchester City striker still hasn't scored against them in the Champions League, a which duck he'll hope to break on Tuesday

arts.ttl: Pep Guardiola apologies to Leyton Orient fans after Man City's FA Cup win
arts.sum: Premier League giants recover after Oâ€™s take the lead in stunning fashion

arts.ttl: Arsenal legend Alan Smith slams Erling Haaland's dad as Man City war of words escalates
arts.sum: Former Arsenal striker Alan Smith has waded into the war of words involving Erling Haaland senior after Myles Lewis-Skelly mimicked his son's goal celebration last weekend

arts.ttl: Man City facing anxious wait on Nico Gonzalez ahead of Real Madrid showdown in Champions League
arts.sum: Manchester City head coach Pep Guardiola 'does not know' whether Nico Gonzalez is facing a spell on the sidelines with the knock that he suffered on his debut.

arts.ttl: Leyton Orient 1-2 Man City: Player ratings as De Bruyne strike spares blushes
arts.sum: James McAtee struck the post as City searched for a winning goal, which they eventually found through Kevin De Bruyne. Rico Lewis' strike from distance took a lucky deflection off the head of half-time substitute Abdukodir Khusanov before nestling into the corner of Keeley's goal.

arts.ttl: Leyton Orient 1-2 Man City: Match report & 3 talking points as Cityzens progress in FA Cup
arts.sum: Manchester City needed Kevin De Bruyne to save them from the bench on Saturday afternoon as they narrowly beat Leyton Orient 2-1 in the FA Cup fourth round. Despite the chasm in quality between the two sides, Orient were not overawed by the reigning Premier League champions during the early stages and scored a staggering opener in the 16th minute.

arts.ttl: Pep Guardiola says Kevin De Bruyne 'saved him from the sack' with Leyton Orient winner
arts.sum: Manchester City needed super-subs Abdukodir Khusanov and Kevin De Bruyne to rescue them after League One Leyton Orient threatened to cause an upset against Pep Guardiola's side

arts.ttl: Real Madrid in the UCL? Right now, Man City struggle to beat Leyton Orient
arts.sum: Real Madrid will hardly be trembling with fear when they watch Manchester City's laboured 2-1 win at Leyton Orient in the FA Cup.

arts.ttl: Rico Lewis reveals half-time message that inspired Man City to comeback win over Leyton Orient in FA Cup
arts.sum: Out of the EFL Cup and sitting 15 points behind Liverpool in the Premier League, the FA Cup looks like City's best hope of serious silverware in 2025. Those hopes were tested at Brisbane Road.
